properties.author: Dr. Williams, Emergency Medicine
properties.text: 62-year-old male with PMH of DM2, HTN presents with acute onset substernal chest pain with radiation to left arm and associated diaphoresis. ECG shows ST elevation in V1-V4 consistent with anterior STEMI. Initial troponin markedly elevated. STEMI alert activated. Cardiology consulted for emergent cardiac catheterization. Patient loaded with aspirin and ticagrelor, heparin bolus given. Cath lab team notified, door-to-balloon target in progress.

properties.description: Anterior and apical wall motion abnormality

properties.author: Dr. Chen, Interventional Cardiology
properties.text: Patient underwent emergent cardiac catheterization for anterior STEMI. Angiography revealed complete occlusion of proximal LAD. Successful primary PCI performed with placement of 3.5x24mm drug-eluting stent. TIMI 3 flow restored. Door-to-balloon time 65 minutes. Patient tolerated procedure well. Transferred to CCU for monitoring. Continue DAPT, beta-blocker, ACE inhibitor, and high-intensity statin.
properties.excerpt: Patient underwent emergent cardiac catheterization for anterior STEMI. Angiography revealed complete occlusion of proximal LAD. Successful primary PCI performed with placement of 3.5x24mm drug-eluting...

properties.author: Dr. Chen, Interventional Cardiology
properties.text: Post-PCI day 1. Patient hemodynamically stable. Chest pain resolved. Troponins trending down. Echo shows EF 40% with anterior WMA consistent with infarct. Will continue medical optimization. Cardiac rehab referral placed. Risk factor modification discussed including diabetes and hypertension control.

events.title: progress Note
events.summary: 62-year-old male with PMH of DM2, HTN presents with acute onset substernal chest pain with radiation to left arm and associated diaphoresis. ECG shows ST elevation in V1-V4 consistent with anterior STEMI. Initial troponin markedly elevated. STEMI alert activated. Cardiology consulted for emergent cardiac catheterization. Patient loaded with aspirin and ticagrelor, heparin bolus given. Cath lab team notified, door-to-balloon target in progress.

events.summary: Complete occlusion of proximal LAD with TIMI 0 flow

events.title: Percutaneous coronary intervention with stent placement
events.summary: Successful revascularization, TIMI 3 flow

events.title: procedure Note
events.summary: Patient underwent emergent cardiac catheterization for anterior STEMI. Angiography revealed complete occlusion of proximal LAD. Successful primary PCI performed with placement of 3.5x24mm drug-eluting stent. TIMI 3 flow restored. Door-to-balloon time 65 minutes. Patient tolerated procedure well. Transferred to CCU for monitoring. Continue DAPT, beta-blocker, ACE inhibitor, and high-intensity statin.

events.summary: No significant valvular disease

events.title: progress Note
events.summary: Post-PCI day 1. Patient hemodynamically stable. Chest pain resolved. Troponins trending down. Echo shows EF 40% with anterior WMA consistent with infarct. Will continue medical optimization. Cardiac rehab referral placed. Risk factor modification discussed including diabetes and hypertension control.
